creator: activehost@gmail.com
text:
Low-Orbit Ion Cannon, broke apache2 with "OPTIONS * HTTP/1.0" requests

previous bug affected by 127.0.0.1 (internal dummy connection)

now afflicting bug on IPv6 interface ::1 with same symptoms.

hope this info helps.

Dan
Can you elaborate in an email to security@apache.org if you think there's an attack that resembles the internal dummy connections that's more than just ddos that could hit any URL?
creator: covener@gmail.com
activehost@gmail.com
text:
See this page for additional bug details:

http://www.pc-freak.net/blog/fixing-127001-options-http10-200-136-apache-internal-dummy-connection-1-13mar2008090513-0200-options-http10-200/

Dan

creator: covener@gmail.com
text:
I don't see any description of a bug, httpd is for bug reports not end-user support.  

If you have a security issue to report, use security@apache.org with a detailed report.

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
Nothing clear in this report, but with respect to the dummy connection, c.f.

http://wiki.apache.org/httpd/InternalDummyConnection

The server performs almost no logic in the OPTIONS * request, it is nothing
but a ping response.  Comment #1 failed to define the word "broke" so this
report remains invalid.
